00020 // This is a standard fall-back constraint which can be used when a
00021 // constraint has not got a better method of implementing their
00022 // inverse for reification.
00023 
00024 #ifndef CONSTRAINT_CHECKASSIGN_H
00025 #define CONSTRAINT_CHECKASSIGN_H
00026 
00027 template<typename VarArray, typename OriginalConstraint>
00028 struct CheckAssignConstraint : public AbstractConstraint
00029 {
00030   virtual string constraint_name()
00031   { return "CheckAssign"; }
00032   
00033   OriginalConstraint& originalcon;
00034   VarArray variables;
00035   ReversibleInt assigned_vars;
00036   // To avoid allocating many vectors.
00037   vector<DomainInt> assignment;
00038   
00039   
00040   CheckAssignConstraint(StateObj* _stateObj, VarArray& vars, OriginalConstraint& con)
00041   : AbstractConstraint(_stateObj), originalcon(con),variables(vars), assigned_vars(stateObj), assignment(variables.size())
00042   { }
00043   
00044   virtual triggerCollection setup_internal()
00045   {
00046     triggerCollection t;
00047     for(unsigned i = 0; i < variables.size(); ++i)
00048       t.push_back(make_trigger(variables[i], Trigger(this, i), Assigned));
00049     return t;
00050   }
00051   
00052   virtual AbstractConstraint* reverse_constraint()
00053   { 
00054     cerr << "Check assign constraints shouldn't get reversed." << endl;
00055     FAIL_EXIT();
00056   }
00057   
00058   virtual void propagate(int prop_val,DomainDelta delta)
00059   {
00060     PROP_INFO_ADDONE(CheckAssign);
00061     if(check_unsat(prop_val, delta))
00062       getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00063   }
00064   
00065   virtual BOOL check_unsat(int,DomainDelta)
00066   {
00067   
00068     int count = assigned_vars;
00069     ++count;
00070     int v_size = variables.size();
00071     D_ASSERT(count <= v_size);
00072 
00073     if(count == v_size)
00074     {
00075       // XXX HACKY HACKY HACK
00076       // OK, this is serious. The problem is that full_check_unsat
00077       // might be called while other events are on the queue
00078       // which end up in this function.
00079       // This is a serious problem for all reified constraints.
00080       // The following would fix it in this case:
00081       // full_check_unsat()
00082       // but that is too expensive in general.
00083       for(int i = 0; i < v_size; ++i)
00084       {
00085         D_ASSERT(variables[i].isAssigned());
00086         assignment[i] = variables[i].getAssignedValue();
00087       }
00088       if(!check_assignment(&assignment.front(), assignment.size()))
00089         return true;
00090     }
00091     assigned_vars = count; 
00092     return false;
00093   }
00094   
00095   virtual BOOL full_check_unsat()
00096   {
00097     unsigned counter = 0;
00098     for(unsigned i = 0; i < variables.size(); ++i)
00099       if(variables[i].isAssigned()) ++counter;
00100     assigned_vars = counter;
00101     
00102     if(counter == variables.size())
00103     {
00104       for(unsigned i = 0; i < variables.size(); ++i)
00105       {
00106         D_ASSERT(variables[i].isAssigned());
00107         assignment[i] = variables[i].getAssignedValue();
00108       }
00109       return !check_assignment(&assignment.front(), assignment.size());
00110     }
00111     return false;
00112   }
00113   
00114   virtual void full_propagate()
00115   {
00116     if(full_check_unsat())
00117       getState(stateObj).setFailed(true);
00118   }
00119   
00120   virtual BOOL check_assignment(DomainInt* v, int v_size)
00121   {
00122     D_ASSERT(v_size == variables.size());
00123     return !originalcon.check_assignment(v, v_size);
00124   }
00125   
00126   virtual vector<AnyVarRef> get_vars()
00127   { 
00128     vector<AnyVarRef> vars;
00129     vars.reserve(variables.size());
00130     for(unsigned i = 0; i < variables.size(); ++i)
00131       vars.push_back(variables[i]);
00132     return vars;
00133   }
00134   
00135   // Getting a satisfying assignment here is too hard
00136      virtual bool get_satisfying_assignment(box<pair<int,DomainInt> >& assignment)
00137    {
00138      MAKE_STACK_BOX(c, DomainInt, variables.size());
00139      
00140      for(int i = 0; i < variables.size(); ++i)
00141      {
00142        if(!variables[i].isAssigned()) 
00143        {  
00144          assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, variables[i].getMin()));
00145          assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, variables[i].getMax()));
00146          return true;
00147        }
00148        else
00149          c.push_back(variables[i].getAssignedValue());
00150      }
00151     
00152     if(check_assignment(c.begin(), c.size()))
00153     {  // Put the complete assignment in the box.
00154       for(int i = 0; i < variables.size(); ++i)
00155       {
00156         assignment.push_back(make_pair(i, c[i]));
00157       }
00158       return true;
00159     }
00160     return false;
00161    }
00162 };
00163 
00164 #endif
